divisions: Office of the Fire Commissioner, Municipal and Northern Support Services

employment_equity.intro_paragraph: The Manitoba government recognizes the importance of building an exemplary public service reflective of the citizens it serves, where diverse abilities, backgrounds, cultures, identities, languages and perspectives drives a high standard of service and innovation. The Manitoba government supports equitable employment practices and promotes representation of designated groups (women, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, visible minorities).
employment_equity.equity_factor_statement: Employment Equity is a factor in selection for this competition. Consideration will be given to Indigenous people and persons with disabilities.

competition_notes.eligibility_list_text: An eligibility list may be created for similar positions and will remain in effect for 12 months.

summary_paragraphs: The Office of the Fire Commissioner is a dynamic work environment that provides front line supports and services to over 130 municipalities, several local authorities, and over 240 fire departments. With locations in Winnipeg, Brandon, and Thompson, the branch builds local level emergency response capacity, provides community support services, and performs emergency response in support of the Manitoba Fire Service, Manitoba Government and Government of Canada. The branch also operates the Manitoba Emergency Services College, a vocational college specializing in diploma and continued education programming for emergency services professionals across Canada.

conditions_of_employment.heading: Conditions of Employment:
items: Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
Must be available to travel throughout the Province of Manitoba with possible overnight stays as required
Must be able to provide and maintain a Criminal Record Check with vulnerable sector search
Must have a valid driver's license
Must be available to work over time, evenings and weekends, and deployed to emergency incidents

qualifications.heading: Qualifications
essential: Post-secondary in Public Administration, Emergency Management or a related field or, a combination of equivalent education and experience in public administration and program management
Experience in project management and research skills related to multi-stakeholder projects
Experience in policy analysis, strategic planning, and program development
Experience researching, developing, evaluating, and recommending strategies and policies on cross-divisional and cross-departmental matters for various stakeholder groups
Excellent analytical and decision-making skills with the ability to lead and coordinate with others to develop policy
Strong organizational skills demonstrating the ability to multi-task and adapt to ever-changing priorities

Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to maintain working relationships and interact effectively with senior government officials, colleagues, various stakeholder groups, and the public using tact and diplomacy
Strong verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with the public and government officials at all levels
Excellent written communication skills required to manage departmental communications including media responses and news releases
Excellent verbal communication skills in French
Excellent written communication skills in French

duties.heading: Duties
duties.intro: The Senior Policy Analyst is a senior advisor to the Fire Commissioner who researches, leads and implements projects and initiatives of strategic importance. The incumbent will lead cross-departmental/divisional or intergovernmental efforts that shape fire protection including legislative enhancements, grant programming, education modernization and accreditation. This role will coordinate and lead complex projects in collaboration with diverse stakeholders and is critical to supporting and sustaining program services delivery, informing broader policy initiatives, and maintaining fire code regulation. The incumbent will prepare various materials such as advisory notes, speaking notes, correspondence, Treasury Board and Cabinet Submissions, and other reports and briefing materials.

instruction_text: WHEN APPLYING TO THIS POSITION, PLEASE INDICATE THE ADVERTISEMENT NUMBER AND POSITION TITLE IN THE SUBJECT LINE AND/OR BODY OF YOUR EMAIL.

Applicants may request reasonable accommodation related to the materials or activities used throughout the selection process. When applying to this position, please indicate the advertisement number and position title in the subject line and/or body of your email. Your cover letter, resumé and/or application must clearly indicate how you meet the qualifications.

Please be advised that job competitions for represented positions may be grieved by internal represented applicants. Should a selection grievance be filed, information from the competition file will be provided to the grievor's representative. Personal information irrelevant to the grievance and other information protected under legislation will be redacted.
We thank all who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
